info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 1:02AM EDT until June 14 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Jefferson County in east central Ohio... Southeastern Columbiana County in east central Ohio... Northeastern Monroe County in east central Ohio... Eastern Belmont County in east central Ohio... Southwestern Beaver County in western Pennsylvania... Western Washington County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Greene County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Ohio County in northern West Virginia... Northeastern Wetzel County in northern West Virginia... Marshall County in northern West Virginia... Brooke County in northern West Virginia... Hancock County in northern West Virginia... * Until 145 AM EDT. * At 101 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Carrollton to 6 miles southwest of Wintersville to St. Clairsville, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Trees snapped and uprooted. Power outages can be expected. * Locations impacted include... Wheeling, Weirton, Steubenville, East Liverpool, Moundsville, Martins Ferry, St. Clairsville, Bellaire, Wellsville, Warwood, Wellsburg, and Bethlehem. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
